Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

I know this is all still subject to change based on our offline discussions regarding deprecating the local queue file. But there are some issues here I wanted to note in any case.

In general it looks like you're chasing after the right problems with the right solutions.

Thanks

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

sorry for the -1 :) Actually, I'm not really like the "lock". Based on my understanding, the scrubber action can be also take it as a "task". That means we'd better to resolve the race condition issue by "task". In other words, I'd like to see Glance do what Nova does. You know, now the "task" of Glance is coming. So I'd like to leverage the "task state" to avoid the race condition. See this: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/api.py#L123

Patch Set 1:

I have committed a separated change for adding a status field to image location at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41311 . Under that status information Scrubber service can make cleanup based on DB records but not a dedicated queue-file for each image as glance-scrubber-refactoring BP required on next step.

Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

A couple of comments inline.  I am also concerned that this requires the scrubber and glance API to be run in the same place.  That was not necessarily true in the past.  How does this effect a horizontal scale out?

Patch Set 4: (3 inline comments)

Gah scrubber is so hard to review. I can't follow any of the original logic at all :-(

I've left a few minor notes inline, but it would really help me a ton if we could somehow break this patch into smaller logical steps.

I've included some minor notes inline, but mostly I'd love to work together to try to better understand both the existing logic in scrubber and the changes that are made here.

Finally, I think that a good portion of scrubber operation is already based on the idea that you are running it directly on the glance api nodes. Well, there are two forms, IIUC. In one form, you run a single deployment of glance-scrubber, and it pulls entries from the database for cleanup. In another, it runs on glance-api nodes and pulls from a local queue file. It doesn't seem to me like this patch changes any of that architecture, but i could be wrong, as I am quite confused about how scrubber works when I look at the code.

Patch Set 5:

Hello John and markwash thanks for you great review and worth comments. I'd like explain my thoughts here to try to resolve your concerns. It's a bit long but easy to understand :P


* How does this effect a horizontal scale out?
As markwash mentioned there are two forms about scurbber deployment, 1) you can deploy glance-scurbber service to glance-api nodes directly or 2) run a single deployment of glance-scrubber. Approach 1) will using queue-file mechanism to delete image data from backend (one or more location). And under 2) scurbber will pulls entries from the database for cleanup, user need enable 'cleanup_scrubber' option. So IMO there are two scale out approach: The first one is just using 1) deployment architecture, run glance-scurbber service on each glance-api nodes, this way allow scale out glance-scurbber with glance-api service, and each glance-scurbber only handle local glance-api image removing request. My second way is that IMO we can change glance-scurbber cleaup mode logic to allow user can deploy scurbber service to more the one node under cleanup mode, and each glance-scurbber deployment/node just handle partial image set, we can adding some new options to control this partition logic, such as image owner, store schema/type or tag.


* What's this change doing?
@markwash this change actually not change current architecture, you are right. As this patch's commit message mentioned this change allow store code and glance-scurbber support multiple-location of the image. If we not do this change then current delay deletion logic will be break, the exception will be raised when user ask delete image with multiple locations. I have not change 'cleanup' logic in the change, but this absolutely is a critical part to me, as we discussed in IRC early, if we want glance-scurbber 'cleanup' mode support multiple-location we have to add a new column to DB, since 1) on 'cleanup' mode scurbber always get image information from DB but queue-file 2) currently on 'cleanup' mode scurbber always assume image only has one locations, that means if image under 'pending_delete' status then all the locations belong this image will all be removed from backend by scurbber, but this is not good for real, user probably only want remove one location from image but not all location. So from above 2 points, IMO we need add a status property to image's location, actually this is separated BP and patch at [1] (thanks John help review it ;)). And also this change, adding 'status' to location, is also good for incoming changes, you know I'd like to move/add some properties to location level from image level, such as 'is_public' and probable 'size, 'checksum', 'format'. Of cause markwash, we maybe need a clearer vision of what all we want on locations, if we grow incrementally without something like the final picture in our minds, we'll end up repeating past mistakes. so i keep location-status change separated and keep minimal change to this patch just allow scurbber and store code support multiple-location situation.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41311/

Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I think this patch has come a long way not just to make the scrubber support multiple locations, but also to clarify the structure of how scrubber works.

I have just a few restructuring suggestions inline, but with those addressed I'm at +2.

Thanks for all your efforts, I'll be online later tonight (your tomorrow morning) to re-review.

Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(10 inline comments)

I have some questions and comments in line.  In general I think this is good for getting multiple locations to work with scrubber.  However there are a few things that I really dont like.  The use of the file system as a data base is confusing.  However I understand that is legacy behavior and this may be a step toward changing it.  I like the db_queue introduction.  I was hoping it would take it a step further and make it so the db_queue could be used instead of the file queue.  This would be nice to see in future work.
Uploaded patch set 10.

Patch Set 9: (12 inline comments)

Thanks for you comments!
